N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.7 - Visits to facilities and programs

State Regulations
(a) Personnel from the office of the
ombudsman are authorized to visit all division facilities and programs at any
time, without prior notice, and at their own discretion. In determining the
priority and frequency of visits, the ombudsman shall consider the following: (1)
court orders, stipulations and
decisions; (2)
statutes and
regulations; (3)
level of security
and population of facilities; (4)
requests for assistance; and
(5)
the nature and seriousness of investigations. (b) The following procedural guidelines are
intended to promote open and cooperative exchanges of information between the
office of the ombudsman and the facility or program staff. (1)

Upon entering a facility or program, the
ombudsman shall make his/her presence known to the appropriate
personnel. (2)

At the ombudsman's
request, the staff shall inform the residents of the ombudsman's
availability. (3)

The ombudsman may
remove a resident from scheduled program activities for consultation. (4)

The ombudsman may meet with a resident or
group of residents and/or employees at his/her discretion. (5)

The facility shall provide a suitable
room, upon request, for private counseling. (6)

The ombudsman shall have the right to
inspect the facility, visit all areas and observe all parts and aspects of the
program. Notes
